title: Linux readlink Command with Practical Examples

steps.title: Understand the Purpose of the readlink Command

verify.name: Verify the purpose of the readlink command
verify.hint: Ensure that you have created the symbolic link `python_link` in the `~/project` directory and that the `readlink` command displays the correct value of `/usr/bin/python3`.

steps.title: Explore the Syntax and Options of the readlink Command

verify.name: Verify the syntax and options of the readlink command
verify.hint: Ensure that the `readlink` command with the `-f`, `-m`, and `-n` options all display the expected value of `/usr/bin/python3` for the `python_link` symbolic link.

steps.title: Practice Resolving Symbolic Links with the readlink Command

verify.name: Verify the resolution of symbolic links
verify.hint: Ensure that the `readlink` command correctly resolves the `ls_link` and `nested_link` symbolic links, and that the `-f` option follows the chain of symbolic links to the final target.
